@atry 2017-04-10 10:31 字数 1394 阅读 1178

Monadic Deep Learning
单子化深度学习

Abstract

Computational graph approach
计算图方法

Most of deep learning frameworks(1, 2) think neural networks as computational graphs. A node in the graph represents a mathematical operation, a function, or even a control flow operation.
大多数深度学习框架（1，2）认为神经网络是计算图。图中的节点表示数学运算、函数甚至控制流运算。

However, neural networks built from those frameworks interoperate badly between their hosting language. For example, a neural network written in Python is not able to use any native Python functions, data structures, nor control flows, during the network running.
然而，从这些框架构建的神经网络在其托管语言之间的互操作很差。例如，用 Python 编写的神经网络在网络运行期间无法使用任何本机 Python 函数、数据结构或控制流。

Automatic differentiation approach
自动区分方法

Recent studies reveal that neural networks and programs are isomorphism(3). Some other libraries treat neural networks as ordinary programs with ability of automatic differentiation(4, 5). Ordinary programming control flow operations are allowed in neural networks.
最近的研究表明，神经网络和程序是同构的（3）。其他一些库将神经网络视为具有自动微分能力的普通程序（4，5）。神经网络中允许进行普通编程控制流操作。

Unfortunately, those libraries have bad performance. They cannot perform multiple calculations parallelly, nor enqueue multiple commands to CUDA streams. Because the programs are directly written by users, those libraries have no room to optimize the computation process.
不幸的是，这些库的性能很差。它们不能并行执行多个计算，也不能将多个命令排队到 CUDA 流。由于程序是由用户直接编写的，因此这些库没有空间来优化计算过程。

Our approach

In DeepLearning.scala, we introduce a new approach that treats neural networks as Monads. Users create neural networks in a way almost the same as ordinary programs, and all Scala language features are available in neural networks. At the mean time, the DeepLearning.scala runtime is still able to schedule computation onto GPU and CPU parallelly.
在DeepLearning.scala中，我们引入了一种将神经网络视为 Monad 的新方法。用户以与普通程序几乎相同的方式创建神经网络，并且所有 Scala 语言功能都可以在神经网络中使用。同时，DeepLearning.scala运行时仍然能够将计算并行调度到GPU和CPU上。

In addition, our monads manage resource automatically, without depending on garbage collection. As a result, unlike other Lua or JVM frameworks, our framework never leaks memory.
此外，我们的monads自动管理资源，而不依赖于垃圾收集。因此，与其他Lua或JVM框架不同，我们的框架永远不会泄漏内存。

DeepLearning.scala 2.0 采访小抄
DeepLearning.scala 2.0 interview transcript

DeepLearning.scala 2.0 的唯一功能
The only feature of DeepLearning.scala 2.0

DeepLearning.scala一共只有一个功能：把程序本身当成神经网络
DeepLearning.scala has only one function: to treat the program itself as a neural network

这一个功能可以从两个角度理解
This one function can be understood from two perspectives

  1. 看成Differiable Programming，认为是内置了学习能力的编程语言。
    Think of it as Differiable Programming, which is a programming language with built-in learning capabilities.
  2. 看成动态神经网络，认为是具备了if、else、for等动态控制流的神经网络。
    Regarded as a dynamic neural network, it is considered to be a neural network with dynamic control flow such as if, else, and for.

目前，动态神经网络被认为是下一代深度学习框架必备的功能。（此处希望佟达补充一下大佬原文出处）
Currently, dynamic neural networks are considered a must-have feature for the next generation of deep learning frameworks. (Here I hope Tong Da will add the original source of the big guy)
是否具备动态神经网络的区别可以看成代差，今后几个月我希望能有机会和晓雷一起实现一些TensorFlow实现不出来的算法，体现这种代差。
The difference between whether or not you have a dynamic neural network can be seen as a generation difference, and in the next few months I hope to have the opportunity to implement some algorithms that cannot be implemented by TensorFlow with Xiaolei to reflect this generation difference.

DeepLearning.scala 怎么用？
How does DeepLearning.scala work?

对于程序员来说，他还是和以前一样写程序，可以使用Scala和Java里的一切普通函数、一切普通控制结构和一切第三方库。只不过他写的程序中，可以额外使用三种具有学习能力的类型，differentiable.Float、differentiable.Double和differentiable.INDArray。使用这三种类型的代码和其他代码都完全一样，没有什么特殊之处，可以和其他代码混在一起写。
For the programmer, he still writes programs as before, using all the common functions, all the common control structures, and all the third-party libraries in Scala and Java. It's just that in the program he wrote, three additional types with learning ability can be used, differentiable.Float , differentiable.Double and differentiable.INDArray . Using these three types of code is exactly the same as the others, there is nothing special, and it can be mixed with other code.

  • 类型differentiable.Float和differentiable.Double类似普通的Float和Double，唯一的区别是在运行过程中，differentiable.Float类型的值会根据训练数据得到反馈、自动修改内部的参数。
    Types differentiable.Float and differentiable.Double are similar to ordinary Float and Double , the only difference is that during runtime, the values of type differentiable.Float will be fed back according to the training data and the internal parameters will be automatically modified.
  • 类型differentiable.INDArray类似nd4j里的INDArray，表示多维数组，唯一的区别是在运行过程中，differentiable.INDArray类型的值会根据训练数据得到反馈、自动修改内部的参数。
    Type differentiable.INDArray is similar to INDArray in nd4j, representing a multidimensional array, the only difference is that during the run, the value of type differentiable.INDArray will be fed back according to the training data and automatically modify the internal parameters.

把程序本身当成神经网络有什么好处？
What are the benefits of treating the program itself as a neural network?

  1. 动态神经网络比静态神经网络功能更强大，能实现出静态神经网络实现不出的算法（对王晓雷很有吸引力）。比如，自然语言处理和语音识别中广泛使用的递归神经网络（RNN）可以看成动态神经网络最简单的一种特例。
    Dynamic neural networks are more powerful than static neural networks, and can implement algorithms that static neural networks cannot implement (very attractive to Wang Xiaolei). For example, recurrent neural networks (RNNs), which are widely used in natural language processing and speech recognition, can be seen as the simplest special case of dynamic neural networks.
  2. 普通代码可以调用神经网络，神经网络也可以调用普通代码。所以，从工程角度看，用DeepLearning.scala实现的算法与业务逻辑的集成很容易。（佟达写的未来的IT系统：DITS - Differentiable IT System也是在讲这个话题）
    Normal code can call a neural network, and a neural network can call normal code. So, from an engineering point of view, the integration of algorithms implemented with DeepLearning.scala with business logic is easy. (Tong Da's "Future IT Systems: DITS - Differentiable IT System" is also talking about this topic.)

DeepLearning.scala能创建怎样的神经网络？
What kind of neural network can DeepLearning.scala create?

虽然DeepLearning.scala只有“把程序本身当成神经网络”一个功能，不过可以给DeepLearning.scala创建的神经网络加一些定语。
Although DeepLearning.scala only has the function of "treating the program itself as a neural network", you can add some qualifiers to the neural network created by DeepLearning.scala.

  1. 支持GPU（目前通过nd4j支持，2.1以后会改用自己写的GPU编译器）
    Support GPU (currently supported by nd4j, will switch to self-written GPU compiler after 2.1)
  2. 支持多线程并行计算（单机情况下可以避免GPU饥饿的情况）
    Support multi-threaded parallel computing (GPU starvation can be avoided in the case of a single machine)
  3. 静态类型（更健壮）
    Static type (more robust)
  4. 基于ThoughtWorks西安Scala学习小组开发的ThoughtWorks Each提供的语法糖，因此可以同时提供两种编程范式。用户可以根据自己习惯任选：
    Based on the syntax sugar provided by ThoughtWorks Each developed by the ThoughtWorks Xi'an Scala learning group, it is possible to provide both programming paradigms at the same time. Users can choose according to their habits:
    • 类似Scalaz语法的函数式编程
      Functional programming similar to Scalaz syntax
    • 类似Java语法的命令式编程。
      Imperative programming similar to Java syntax.

DeepLearning.scala 2.0 和其他深度学习框架的对比
Comparison of DeepLearning.scala 2.0 and other deep learning frameworks

DeepLearning.scala 2.0 vs TensorFlow 和其他老牌深度学习框架
DeepLearning.scala 2.0 vs TensorFlow and other established deep learning frameworks

  • DeepLearning.scala 的优点
    Advantages of DeepLearning.scala
    • 动态神经网络
      Dynamic neural networks
    • 静态类型系统
      Static type system
    • 与JVM的企业生态环境的互操作性(interoperability)
      Interoperability with the JVM's enterprise ecosystem
  • TensorFlow 的优点
    Advantages of TensorFlow
    • 分布式训练（支持超大规模神经网络）
      Distributed training (supports very large neural networks)

DeepLearning.scala 2.0 vs Chainer
DeepLearning.scala 2.0 vs Chainer

Chainer是新出的支持动态神经网络的Python深度学习框架。最近比较火。
Chainer is a new Python deep learning framework that supports dynamic neural networks. Recently it's been more popular.

  • DeepLearning.scala 的优点
    Advantages of DeepLearning.scala
    • 多线程并行计算（性能高于Chainer）
      Multi-threaded parallel computing (higher performance than Chainer)
    • 静态类型系统
      Static type system
    • 与JVM的企业生态环境的互操作性
      Interoperability with the JVM's enterprise ecosystem
  • 平手
    • 动态神经网络
      Dynamic neural networks

DeepLearning.scala 2.0 vs Deeplearning4j
DeepLearning.scala 2.0 vs Deeplearning4j

Deeplearning4j和DeepLearning.scala类似，都是JVM上的深度学习框架。
Deeplearning4j, similar to DeepLearning.scala, is a deep learning framework on the JVM.
Deeplearning4j的公司开发了一个多维数组库 nd4j 。DeepLearning.scala 2.0也使用nd4j。
Deeplearning4j's company has developed a multidimensional array library, nd4j. DeepLearning.scala 2.0 also uses nd4j.
Deeplearning4j根本不具备任何定制算法的能力，只能调用作者内置的几个网络层。
Deeplearning4j simply does not have the ability to customize algorithms and can only call a few network layers built into the author.

  • DeepLearning.scala 的优点
    Advantages of DeepLearning.scala
    • 定制算法的能力
      The ability to customize algorithms
    • 动态神经网络
      Dynamic neural networks
  • 平手
    • 与JVM的企业生态环境的互操作性
      Interoperability with the JVM's enterprise ecosystem
    • 静态类型系统
      Static type system

DeepLearning.scala 2.0 vs DeepLearning.scala 1.0
DeepLearning.scala 2.0 vs DeepLearning.scala 1.0

DeepLearning.scala 1.0的目标也是把程序本身当成神经网络。但DeepLearning.scala 1.0并不能支持所有的编程语言特性。
The goal of DeepLearning.scala 1.0 is also to treat the program itself as a neural network. But DeepLearning.scala 1.0 doesn't support all programming language features.

  • DeepLearning.scala 1.0支持：
    DeepLearning.scala 1.0 supports:
    • if和switch两种控制语句
      There are two control statements: if and switch
    • Float、Double、INDArray、Int、Boolean五种可以在神经网络中使用的基本数据结构
      Float , Double , INDArray , Int , Boolean five basic data structures can be used in neural networks
    • ADT复合数据结构
      ADT composite data structure
  • DeepLearning.scala 1.0不支持
    Not supported in DeepLearning.scala 1.0
    • for和while控制语句
      for and while control statements
    • 除了上述五种类型以外的Scala/Java数据类型
      Scala/Java data types other than the above five types
    • 原生的Scala GADT复合数据结构
      Native Scala GADT composite data structure
    • 原生的Java class/interface数据结构
      Native Java class/interface data structure
    • 在神经网络中调用普通的Scala/Java函数
      Call normal Scala/Java functions in a neural network

DeepLearning.scala 2.0支持所有Scala/Java语言特性。
DeepLearning.scala 2.0 supports all Scala/Java language features.

DeepLearning.scala 后续计划
DeepLearning.scala follow-up plan

DeepLearning.scala 2.1：MapReduce on GPU

DeepLearning.scala眼下的燃眉之急在于nd4j太弱，既难用又缺功能，导致 DeepLearning.scala 2.0 支持的算法比 TensorFlow 少。
DeepLearning.scala's immediate need is that nd4j is too weak, difficult to use and lacking in functionality, resulting in DeepLearning.scala 2.0 supporting fewer algorithms than TensorFlow.

我们正在开发的 DeepLearning.scala 2.1 中将使用我们自己的多维数组库来代替 nd4j。
We are working on DeepLearning.scala 2.1 that will use our own multidimensional array library instead of nd4j.
我们自己的多维数组库使用一个JIT的编译器，能把MapReduce风格的代码编译为GPU上的神经网络。这种MapReduce风格的API用起来很像Spark，但有两个区别：a)运行在GPU上； b)具有学习能力。
Our own multidimensional array library uses a JIT compiler to compile MapReduce-style code into neural networks on the GPU. This MapReduce style API works a lot like Spark, but with two differences: a) it runs on the GPU; b) Ability to learn.

届时 DeepLearning.scala 将由两个层次组成：
DeepLearning.scala will consist of two levels:

  • 上层支持完整的Scala语言，提供神经网络层结构之间的粗粒度控制。（即DeepLearning.scala 2.0的动态神经网络）
    The upper layer supports the full Scala language, providing coarse-grained control between neural network layer structures. (i.e. the dynamic neural network of DeepLearning.scala 2.0)
  • 底层支持GPU上的MapReduce，提供每个神经网络层内部的细粒度计算。（即DeepLearning.scala 2.1的MapReduce on GPU）
    The underlying layer supports MapReduce on the GPU, providing fine-grained computation inside each neural network layer. (i.e. MapReduce on GPU for DeepLearning.scala 2.1)

DeepLearning.scala 2.x：算法应用
DeepLearning.scala 2.x: Algorithmic applications

在 DeepLearning.scala 2.1 发布以后，我们会暂停主要功能的开发，而把重点放在算法应用和生态环境建设上。
After the release of DeepLearning.scala 2.1, we will suspend the development of major functions and focus on algorithm applications and ecosystem construction.

  • 在定制新神经网络层时，用别的框架需要手写CUDA代码外加数百行Python代码才能完成的功能，DeepLearning.scala 2.x基于动态神经网络+MapReduce的话，只要几十行代码。
    When customizing the new neural network layer, DeepLearning.scala 2.x is based on dynamic neural networks + MapReduce for functions that require handwritten CUDA code plus hundreds of lines of Python code to complete, DeepLearning.scala 2.x based on dynamic neural networks + MapReduce, only a few dozen lines of code.
  • 我们将提供算法发布平台，让算法开发者可以在30秒内就把自己编写的神经网络层发布为开源库，供社区使用。
    We will provide an algorithm publishing platform that allows algorithm developers to publish their neural network layers as open-source libraries for community use within 30 seconds.
  • 我们自己将利用DeepLearning.scala的动态神经网络和MapReduce on GPU两大功能，开发TensorFlow写不出来的算法DEMO。
    We will use DeepLearning.scala's dynamic neural network and MapReduce on GPU capabilities to develop an algorithm demo that TensorFlow can't write.

DeepLearning.scala 3.0+：分布式模型
DeepLearning.scala 3.0+: Distributed model

目前DeepLearning.scala 2.0已经支持了异步多线程计算，DeepLearning.scala 3.0以后将在异步多线程计算的基础上支持集群上的分布式模型。
At present, DeepLearning.scala 2.0 has supported asynchronous multi-threaded computing, and DeepLearning.scala 3.0 will support the distributed model on the cluster on the basis of asynchronous multi-threaded computing.

DeepLearning.scala 3.0+：Java支持
DeepLearning.scala 3.0+: Java support

DeepLearning.scala可以很方便的调用Java库，Java代码也可以很方便的调用DeepLearning.scala创建的神经网络。但是目前算法开发者必须用Scala语言来编写神经网络。
DeepLearning.scala can easily call Java libraries, and Java code can easily call neural networks created by DeepLearning.scala. But for now, algorithm developers have to write neural networks in Scala.

我们将在DeepLearning.scala 3.0以后，开发一个Java到定制版Scala的编译器，让算法开发者可以直接使用Java语言编写神经网络，然后我们的编译器把Java代码编译成DeepLearning.scala。
After DeepLearning.scala 3.0, we will develop a Java to custom version of Scala compiler, so that algorithm developers can write neural networks directly in Java, and then our compiler will compile the Java code into DeepLearning.scala.

DeepLearning.scala 3.0+：Spark、Hadoop、Kafka等第三方框架集成
DeepLearning.scala 3.0+: Integration of third-party frameworks such as Spark, Hadoop, Kafka, etc

DeepLearning.scala本身只是一门特定领域的语言（DSL），可以和任何JVM库交互。然而，用户可能更期待傻瓜式的整合，如果我们能提供一些以Spark Stream、HDFS、Kafka为数据源调用DeepLearning.scala的工具库，用户会更方便些。虽然社区很可能可以帮我们完成这部分工作，但我们至少需要在早期提供整合到第三方框架的样板程序。
DeepLearning.scala itself is just a domain-specific language (DSL) that can interact with any JVM library. However, users may be more looking forward to point-and-shoot integration, and it would be more convenient if we could provide some libraries that call DeepLearning.scala with Spark Stream, HDFS, and Kafka as data sources. While the community will most likely be able to help us with this, we need to at least provide boilerplate for integration into third-party frameworks early on.

Reactive Monad, done right.
反应性莫纳德，做得对。

Abstract

Most of the reactive framework provide subscribe and unsubscribe methods on reactive objects for event handling. Reactive systems built from these frameworks will leak memory or duplicate events if the users do not properly call unsubscribe. However, in complex reactive system, it is difficult to determine the timing to unsubscribe.
大多数响应式框架在反应式对象上提供 subscribe 和 unsubscribe 方法，用于事件处理。如果用户未正确调用 unsubscribe ，则从这些框架构建的反应式系统将泄漏内存或重复事件。然而，在复杂的反应式系统中，很难确定退订的时间。

Some reactive frameworks have the concept of ownership, which aims to automatically unsubscribe an object when its owner is killed. Unfortunately, this approach does not work for complicated diamond dependencies.
一些反应式框架具有所有权的概念，其目的是在对象的所有者被杀死时自动取消订阅。遗憾的是，此方法不适用于复杂的钻石依赖关系。

In Binding.scala, we introduce a new approach that encapsulates reactive objects into a pure Monad with no side-effect. Event listeners are managed internally by Binding.scala runtime, and there is no public subscribe or unsubscribe method for users.
在 Binding.scala 中，我们引入了一种新方法，该方法将响应式对象封装到纯 Monad 中，没有副作用。事件侦听器由 Binding.scala 运行时在内部管理，并且没有供用户使用的公共 subscribe 或 unsubscribe 方法。

As a result, a reactive system built with Binding.scala never leaks memory or duplicate events.
因此，使用 Binding.scala 构建的反应式系统永远不会泄漏内存或重复事件。

附录：Binding.scala快速上手指南
Appendix: Binding.scala Quick Start Guide

基本用法
Basic usage

Binding.scala 的基本用法很像 ReactJS ，也是通过编写模板把数据映射成 HTML 。
The basic usage of Binding.scala is much like ReactJS, and it is also written by writing templates to map data to HTML.

第零步：构建脚本配置
Step zero: Build the script configuration

首先，你需要设置项目的构建脚本。Binding.scala 就是普通的 Scala.js 库，按普通的 Scala.js 项目配置方式即可。具体参考 Scala.js 的教程或者TodoMVC的源码仓库。
First, you need to set up the project's build script. Binding.scala is an ordinary Scala .js library, which can be configured according to the normal Scala .js project. See the Scala .js tutorial or the TodoMVC repository.

第一步：添加 Binding.scala 的依赖
Step 1: Add dependencies for Binding.scala

修改你的 build.sbt 文件，加入以下两行
Modify your build.sbt file to include the following two lines

  1. libraryDependencies += "com.thoughtworks.binding" %%% "dom" % "latest.release"
  3. addCompilerPlugin("org.scalamacros" % "paradise" % "2.1.0" cross CrossVersion.full)

第二步：定义 HTML 模板
Step 2: Define the HTML template

  1. @dom
  2. def spinner(i: Var[Int]) = {
  3.   <div>
  4.     <button onclick={ event: Event => i := i.get - 1 }>-</button>
  5.     { i.bind.toString }
  6.     <button onclick={ event: Event => i := i.get + 1 }>+</button>
  7.   </div>
  8. }
  10. @dom
  11. def render = {
  12.   val i = Var(0)
  13.   <div>
  14.     { spinner(i).bind }
  15.     控件当前值是：{ i.bind.toString }
  16.   </div>
  17. }

你可以在Binding.scala的DEMO网站实际运行一下试试。
You can try it out on the Binding.scala demo website.

Scala 代码的语法和 ECMAScript 6 很接近。有 JavaScript 经验的同学只要参考
The syntax of Scala code is very close to ECMAScript 6. Students with JavaScript experience only need to refer to it
From ES6 to Scala 就可以迁移到 Scala.js 了。
From ES6 to Scala is ready to migrate to Scala.js.

以上 Scala 代码创建了两个 HTML 模板，其中 spinner 是个数字选择组件，render 是页面的内容。Binding.scala 支持 Scala 代码和 HTML 模板混合编写，所以 onclick={...} 把一个 Scala 函数设置给了 HTML 属性 onclick 。
The above Scala code creates two HTML templates, where spinner is a number selection component and render is the content of the page. Binding.scala supports mixed writing of Scala code and HTML templates, so onclick={...} sets a Scala function to HTML attribute onclick .

上述代码用到了 Binding.scala 的几个API：
The above code uses several APIs from Binding.scala:

  • @dom 把方法标记成绑定表达式，在这个方法内可以编写 HTML 模板、可以使用 .bind 监听其他 HTML 模板或变量。
    @dom marks the method as a binding expression, within which HTML templates can be written, and .bind can be used to listen to other HTML templates or variables.

  • Binding 是绑定表达式。上面代码的 spinner(i)、render 和 i 都是 Binding 。
    Binding is the binding expression. The spinner(i) , render, and i of the code above are all Binding.

    • Binding.bind 用来监听绑定表达式。
      Binding.bind is used to listen for binding expressions.

    xxx.bind的含义是“each time xxx changes”。比如 @dom def j = i.bind + 5 表示每当 i 改变时，j也改变，j的值是 i 的值加5。
    The meaning of xxx.bind is "each time xxx changes". For example, @dom def j = i.bind + 5 means that whenever i changes, j also changes, and the value of j is the value of i plus 5.

    注意：bind表示绑定表达式之间的依赖关系，所以只能写在绑定表达式的内部。bind不是普通的函数！
    Note: bind indicates a dependency between binding expressions, so it can only be written inside the binding expression. bind is not an ordinary function!

  • Var 是可以被监听的变量，Var继承了Binding。上面代码中的 i 就是个 Var。
    Var is the variable that can be listened to, and Var inherits Binding . The i in the above code is a Var .
    • Var.bind 继承自 Binding.bind，表示要监听变量的值。
      Var.bind is inherited from Binding.bind and indicates the value of the variable to listen for.
    • Var.get 获取变量的当前值，不能写在绑定表达式中。
      Var.get Gets the current value of the variable and cannot be written in a binding expression.
    • := 对变量的赋值，并重新计算所有依赖该变量的绑定表达式，不能写在绑定表达式中。
      := assigns a value to a variable and reevaluates all binding expressions that depend on that variable, and cannot be written in binding expressions.

注意：{ event: Event => i := i.get + 1 }没加 @dom ，是个普通的函数而不是绑定表达式，所以其中可以使用 get 和 := 。
Note: { event: Event => i := i.get + 1 } is not added @dom, it is a normal function rather than a binding expression, so you can use get and := .

这两个 HTML 模板之间传递了绑定变量 i 作为参数。所以，当 spinner 内的 onclick 修改 i 时，spinner 和 render 中的 i.bind 都会触发，实现了类似双向绑定的效果。
A binding variable i is passed as a parameter between the two HTML templates. Therefore, when the onclick within spinner modifies i , both spinner and i.bind in render are triggered, achieving an effect similar to two-way binding.

第三步：渲染 HTML
Step 3: Render HTML

编写完功能后，你需要在 main 中把 render 渲染出来。
After writing the feature, you need to render the render in main .

  1. @JsExport def main() = {
  2.   dom.render(document.body, render)
  3. }
  • dom.render 接受两个参数，第一个参数表示要把模板渲染到哪个位置，第二个参数是将要渲染的模板。
    dom.render accepts two arguments, the first parameter indicates where the template is to be rendered, and the second parameter is the template that will be rendered.

最后在静态 HTML 中调用 main() 方法：
Finally, call the main() method in the static HTML:

  1. <script type="text/javascript"> SampleMain().main() </script>

这样一来整个程序就写完了。
So that the whole program is written.

容器和循环
Containers and loops

复杂的网页上往往会有重复的元素，可以把数据保存到 Vars 容器，然后用 for / yield 渲染。
Complex web pages often have duplicate elements, and you can save the data to the Vars container and then render it with for / yield .

比如

  1. @dom def render = {
  2.   val logs = Vars("Hello", "Binding.scala")
  3.   <div>
  4.     { for { log <- logs } yield <div>{ log }</div> }
  5.   </div>
  6. }

以上代码通过 for / yield 语句渲染了两行文字，你可以在Binding.scala的DEMO网站实际运行一下试试
The above code renders two lines of text through the for / yield statement, you can actually run it on the Binding.scala DEMO website

Vars 是可以被监听的容器。所以，每当 Vars 的内容修改时，渲染出的网页也会自动修改：
Vars is the container that can be listened to. Therefore, whenever the content of Vars is modified, the rendered web page will also be automatically modified:

  1. @dom def render = {
  2.   val logs = Vars("Input code:")
  3.   val input = <input type="text"/>
  4.   val submitHandler = { event: Event =>
  5.     logs.get += input.value
  6.     logs.get += js.eval(input.value).toString
  7.     input.value = ""
  8.     event.preventDefault()
  9.   }
  10.   <form onsubmit={ submitHandler }>
  11.     { for { log <- logs } yield <div>{ log }</div> }
  12.     { input }
  13.   </form>
  14. }

以上代码实现了一个代码控制台，你可以在输入框中输入代码，按下回车键，就能看到代码执行结果。
The above code implements a code console, you can enter the code in the input box, press the Enter key, and you can see the code execution result.
你可以在Binding.scala的DEMO网站实际运行一下试试。
You can try it out on the Binding.scala demo website.

Vars.get 类似 Var.get，用来容器的当前值，返回值是个 scala.collection.mutable.Buffer。
Vars.get is like Var.get , the current value of the container, and the return value is a scala.collection.mutable.Buffer.
所以你还可以对 Var.get 取得的当前值调用 Buffer 的 += 等各种方法，直接进行修改容器的当前值。
So you can also call Buffer's += and other methods to the current value obtained by Var.get to directly modify the current value of the container.
当你修改这个 Buffer 时，会触发 Binding.scala 自动执行对应操作，把修改集映射到 for / yield 生成的页面上。
When you modify this Buffer , it triggers Binding.scala to automatically perform the corresponding operation, mapping the changeset to the for / yield generated page.

比如，logs.get += input.value 添加了一个字符串，那么渲染出的网页上也会添加一行包含该字符串的 <div> ，而不需要修改网页上原有的其他部分。
For example, if logs.get += input.value adds a string, a row containing <div> of the string will be added to the rendered web page, without modifying other parts of the page.

注意，Vars.get 、 += 就像 Var.get 和 := 一样，也不能在@dom绑定表达式或代码模板中调用，而只能在其他函数中调用。
Note that Vars.get and += , like Var.get and := , cannot be called in @dom binding expressions or code templates, but only in other functions.
比如以上代码的 submitHandler 回调函数不是一个 @dom 函数，所以可以在其中修改 logs。
For example, the submitHandler callback function in the above code is not a @dom function, so you can modify logs in it.

神经网络与函数式编程（一）从CEO的水晶球到神经网络编程
Neural Networks and Functional Programming (I) From the CEO's crystal ball to neural network programming

神经网络与函数式编程

打电话的故事
The story of the call

有一家银行，是我们的客户。银行有一项电话营销业务，他们的呼叫中心每个月会拨出很多通电话向用户推销他们的某产品，其中只有很小一部分用户最终同意办理业务。
There is a bank that is our customer. Banks have a telemarketing business where their call center makes many calls each month to promote one of their products, and only a small percentage of users eventually agree to do business.
银行很希望找到一个办法，提高办理业务的成功率。
Banks are keen to find a way to improve the success rate of doing business.

于是，我们用机器学习技术，帮银行建立了一个精准营销的模型，可以根据用户资料，预测用户有多大几率会办理业务。我们的程序会从所有用户中列出最优质的潜在用户，让坐席员去拨打电话。
Therefore, we used machine learning technology to help banks build a precision marketing model, which can predict how likely users are to handle business based on user data. Our program lists the best quality potential users from all users and allows agents to make calls.

银行的呼叫中心每个月会拨打超过一千万通电话，模型从每个月这些拨出记录中不断地学习、优化，持续提升预测能力。
The bank's call center makes more than 10 million calls per month, and the model continuously learns, optimizes, and continuously improves its predictive capabilities from these outgoing records each month.

过去，客户人工来选出目标用户, 业务办理的成功率只有8%。现在，我们的模型推荐潜在用户，成功率是46%，比原本的5倍还要多。
In the past, customers manually selected target users, and the success rate of business processing was only 8%. Now, our model recommends potential users with a success rate of 46%, which is more than 5 times the original.

CEO的水晶球
CEO's crystal ball

银行项目之后，我们试着把机器学习复用到更广泛的业务领域中。我们开发了一个产品：CEO的水晶球。
After the banking project, we tried to reuse machine learning into a broader business area. We developed a product: the CEO's crystal ball.

CEO的水晶球可以对任意二维表数据进行预测。除了类似呼叫中心的精准营销以外，还可以进行趋势预测、异常检测、相关商品推荐，用于零售、金融、医疗、互联网在内的各行各业。
The CEO's crystal ball can make predictions on any two-dimensional table data. In addition to precision marketing similar to call centers, it can also carry out trend prediction, anomaly detection, and related product recommendations, which can be used in various industries such as retail, finance, medical care, and the Internet.

水晶球可以自动建模，不需要数据科学家参与。只要 5 秒钟，就可以从你现有的Excel、数据库或是数据湖中的数据来创造出一枚水晶球，马上就能预测新的数据。
Crystal balls can be modeled automatically and do not require the involvement of data scientists. In just 5 seconds, you can create a crystal ball from data in your existing Excel, database, or data lake and predict new data in no time.
随着数据量的增长，水晶球会自动预测得越来越准。
As the amount of data grows, the crystal ball will automatically predict more and more accurately.

DeepLearning.scala
DeepLearning.scala

水晶球的底层，是我们自己开发的深度学习框架：DeepLearning.scala。
At the bottom of the crystal ball is our own deep learning framework: DeepLearning.scala.

科学家的深度学习
Deep learning for scientists

其他深度学习框架，比如TensorFlow、Caffe、Torch、Theano，目标是让数据科学家解决机器学习中，某个限定问题域的特定问题。一名大学的科学家可能使用Theano设计一个神经网络对特定的数据集（比如1000张自然风光的图片）进行图像识别，科学家建立的神经网络可以回答每张图片上有什么东西。他的工作就是优化网络结构和各种参数，试图把准确率从95%提高到95.1%。
Other deep learning frameworks, such as TensorFlow, Caffe, Torch, Theano, aim to enable data scientists to solve a specific problem in machine learning that defines a problem domain. A university scientist might use Theano to design a neural network to recognize images on a specific data set, such as 1,000 images of natural scenery, and the scientist could build a neural network that could answer what was on each image. His job was to optimize the network structure and various parameters, trying to improve the accuracy from 95% to 95.1%.

DeepLearning.scala和等其他主流深度学习框架一样，也支持自动求导、支持符号计算、支持GPU计算，数据科学家也能使用DeepLearning.scala进行类似的研究。然而，除了针对传统机器学习的学术问题以外，DeepLearning.scala还有一些独有的特性，针对的使用场景和目标用户截然不同。
DeepLearning.scala, like other mainstream deep learning frameworks, supports automatic derivation, symbolic computing, and GPU computing, and data scientists can use DeepLearning.scala for similar research. However, in addition to the academic problems aimed at traditional machine learning, DeepLearning.scala has some unique features that target very different use cases and target users.

程序员的深度学习
Deep learning for programmers

除了刚才说的数学运算以外，DeepLearning.scala还支持if/else、switch/case这样的控制语句，而且所有的这些控制语句都有学习能力。DeepLearning也支持用户自定义数据结构、比如struct和List，而且这些数据结构也有学习能力。归根到底，DeepLearning.scala是一门具有学习能力的编程语言。
In addition to the math operations just mentioned, DeepLearning.scala also supports control statements such as if/else, switch/case, and all of these control statements have the ability to learn. DeepLearning also supports user-defined data structures such as structs and lists, and these data structures also have the ability to learn. At the end of the day, DeepLearning.scala is a programming language with the ability to learn.

DeepLearning.scala的目标用户是普通工程师，他们仍然可以像过去一样写程序，唯一区别是，用DeepLearning.scala写的程序有学习功能，会自己修改自己的参数，因为用DeepLearning.scala写的程序本身就是结构极其复杂的神经网络。
DeepLearning.scala's target users are ordinary engineers who can still write programs as they used to, the only difference is that programs written with DeepLearning.scala have a learning function and will modify their own parameters, because programs written in DeepLearning.scala are themselves neural networks with extremely complex structures.

这种把程序本身当做神经网络的方式，叫做Differentiable Programming。DeepLearning.scala是世界上第一个JVM这样的主流平台上的Differentiable Programming框架。
This way of treating the program itself as a neural network is called Differentiable Programming. DeepLearning.scala is the world's first Differentiable Programming framework on mainstream platforms like the JVM.

利用DeepLearning.scala提供的Differentiable Programming，你可以把非常复杂的业务知识放在神经网络之内，用机器学习直接处理业务逻辑，而不只是解决限定问题域的一个专有问题。
With Differentiable Programming provided by DeepLearning.scala, you can put very complex business knowledge within neural networks and use machine learning to deal directly with business logic, rather than just solving a proprietary problem that defines the problem domain.

假以时日，将来每个程序员写的每一段代码都可以方便的内置学习能力，就像调用函数一样简单。
Over time, every piece of code written by every programmer in the future will be able to easily build in the learning ability, as simple as calling a function.

开源！
Open source!

现在，DeepLearning.scala已经开源。
Now, DeepLearning.scala is open sourced.
试试吧，因为我们真的很想知道你会用DeepLearning.scala来创造些什么！
Give it a try, because we really want to know what you'll create with DeepLearning.scala!

下期预告
Upcoming Period

在More than Machine Learning系列的下一篇文章，我将介绍DeepLearning.scala的类型系统。有了类型系统，用DeepLearning.scala创建每个子神经网络都有静态检查的输入输出类型，有自己的API签名。程序员可以像调用函数一样组合多个子神经网络。因此，DeepLearning.scala的复用性远远超过TensorFlow等其他深度学习框架，更适合多人协作的复杂业务项目。
In the next article in the More than Machine Learning series, I'll cover DeepLearning.scala's type system. With the type system, each subneural network created with DeepLearning.scala has a statically checked input and output type, with its own API signature. Programmers can combine multiple subneural networks as if they were calling a function. Therefore, DeepLearning.scala's reusability far exceeds that of other deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, and is more suitable for complex business projects where multiple people collaborate.

神经网络与函数式编程（二）神经网络是什么？
Neural Networks and Functional Programming (II) What is a Neural Network?

神经网络与函数式编程

在本系列的上一篇文章More than Machine Learning（一）从CEO的水晶球到神经网络编程中，我介绍了开源项目DeepLearning.scala的动机是成为一门具有学习能力的编程语言，即神经网络上的编程语言。在本篇文章中，我将探讨一个问题：怎样看待神经网络？
In the previous article in this series, More than Machine Learning (I) From the CEO's crystal ball to neural network programming, I introduced the open source project DeepLearning.scala, which was motivated by becoming a learning programming language, i.e. a programming language on neural networks. In this article, I'll explore a question: What do you think about neural networks?

神经网络是仿生学？
Are neural networks bionics?

神经网络这个词，原本出自描述生物神经系统的神经科学，指的是生物体内神经元相互连接组成的网络。
The term neural network, originally derived from neuroscience describing the biological nervous system, refers to the network of interconnected neurons in an organism.

1951年，马文·闵斯基借鉴“大脑模型”设计了最早的人工神经网络SNARC。在他设想中，大脑模型是个分形结构。每个神经元都有自己的输入和输出，若干互相连接的神经元组成一个小的神经网络。神经网络的输入和输出要比单个神经元复杂一些。而小的神经网络之间互相连接又组成了更大的神经网络。以此类推，最终这个“大脑模型”就是一个超大规模的神经网络。
In 1951, Marvin Minsky used the "brain model" to design the first artificial neural network SNARC. In his vision, the brain model is a fractal structure. Each neuron has its own input and output, and several interconnected neurons form a small neural network. The inputs and outputs of a neural network are a bit more complex than individual neurons. And the interconnection of small neural networks makes up a larger neural network. By analogy, the final "brain model" is a supermassive neural network.

类比生物神经系统，这是看待神经网络的第一种方式。
By analogy with the biological nervous system, this is the first way to look at neural networks.

神经网络是特征提取？
Are neural networks feature extraction?

在机器学习领域，神经网络则被用来提取特征。这种视角下，每个神经元是一个特征。使用一个神经网络处理一条数据样本时，其中的神经元会有不同的激活程度。如果把处理一个样本时的多个神经元的激活程度看成一个特征向量，那么这个特征向量就是神经网络对这一个样本的编码。
In the field of machine learning, neural networks are used to extract features. In this perspective, each neuron is a feature. When a neural network is used to process a sample of data, the neurons in it have different degrees of activation. If the degree of activation of multiple neurons when processing a sample is regarded as a feature vector, then this feature vector is the neural network's encoding of this sample.

神经网络的每一个激活模式对应了一个概念。假如两个样本都会导致同几个神经元被激活，那么就表示两个样本很类似，比如可能是近义词或者属于相同的分类。
Each activation pattern of a neural network corresponds to a concept. If both samples cause the same neurons to be activated, it means that the two samples are similar, for example, they may be synonymous or belong to the same category.

比如，假如有一个word2vec模型，当用这个模型编码词语“Scala”时，编码后的特征向量中，“函数式编程”、“面向对象编程”、“JVM”等特征可能就会激活，而这些特征共同构成了“Scala”这一概念。
For example, if there is a word2vec model, when the word "Scala" is coded with this model, the features such as "functional programming", "object-oriented programming", and "JVM" may be activated in the encoded feature vector, and these features together constitute the concept of "Scala".

特征提取，这是看待神经网络的第二种方式。
Feature extraction, which is the second way to look at neural networks.

神经网络是函数式编程？
Are neural networks functional programming?

两年前，谷歌大脑的科学家克里斯多夫·欧拉写了一篇文章Neural Networks, Types, and Functional Programming，他认为神经网络的结构和函数式编程是一样的。函数式编程可能会成为30年后人们看待神经网络的方式。
Two years ago, Google Brain scientist Christopher Euler wrote an article called Neural Networks, Types, and Functional Programming, arguing that the structure of neural networks is the same as functional programming. Functional programming may be the way people look at neural networks in 30 years.

尽管克里斯多夫·欧拉指出了函数式编程和神经网络的对应关系，但当时这还只是个构想。而现在，在DeepLearning.scala中，他的构想已经成为现实。各种类型的神经网络都可以通过各种函数的相互组合构造出来。
Although Christopher Euler pointed out the correspondence between functional programming and neural networks, it was just an idea at the time. Now, in DeepLearning.scala, his vision has become a reality. Various types of neural networks can be constructed by combining various functions with each other.

接下来，我会用DeepLearning.scala用函数式编程的方式写一些神经网络的例子。这些例子我全部采用元素级别的高阶函数来编写。元素级别的高阶函数操作要比其他框架常用的向量操作更灵活、更强大，而且有可能更接近神经网络的本质。但是，DeepLearning.scala 2.x版本的元素级别操作不支持GPU，要比向量操作慢成千上万倍，只适合小数据量的算法原型。我们正在开发的DeepLearning.scala 3.0将会支持在GPU上运行的高性能元素级别操作。
Next, I'll use DeepLearning.scala to write some examples of neural networks in a functional programming way. I wrote all these examples using higher-order functions at the element level. Higher-order function operations at the element level are more flexible and powerful than vector operations commonly used by other frameworks, and may be closer to the essence of neural networks. However, DeepLearning.scala version 2.x does not support GPU, is thousands of times slower than vector operations, and is only suitable for small data volume algorithm prototypes. DeepLearning.scala 3.0 we are working on will support high-performance element-level operations running on GPUs.

神经网络是函数
Neural networks are functions

假如我们要用神经网络做一个智商测试机器人，可以解答类似这样问题：
If we want to use neural networks to make an IQ test robot, we can answer questions like this:

3,4,5 - 下一個數字是？
3,4,5 - What is the next number?

13,19,25 - 下一個數字是？
13, 19, 25 - What is the next number?

如果用DeepLearning.scala的话，我们可以把这个机器人设计成如下签名的函数：
If we use DeepLearning.scala, we can design the bot as a signed function like this:

  1. def guessNextNumber(question: Seq[Double]): DoubleLayer = ???

然后可以这样使用机器人，让机器人作答：
You can then use the bot like this and have the bot answer:

  1. println(guessNextNumber(Seq(3, 4, 5)).predict.blockingAwait)
  2. println(guessNextNumber(Seq(13, 19, 25)).predict.blockingAwait)

我们可以发现，在调用智商测试机器人的predict方法时，guessNextNumber可以接受普通的参数，像普通函数调用一样执行神经网络的推理。
We can find that when calling the predict method of the IQ test robot, guessNextNumber can accept ordinary parameters and perform the reasoning of the neural network like a normal function call.

这就是我们的第一个结论：神经网络是函数。
This is our first conclusion: neural networks are functions.

神经网络是可以学习的函数
Neural networks are functions that can be learned

然而，从机器学习的定义上讲，神经网络用起来不像纯函数，因为纯函数要求对相同的输入值一定产生相同的輸出。然而，当我们构造智商测试机器人的时候，我们并不期待机器人一诞生就能工作得很好。它应该事先不懂得任何规律，要通过做题训练之后才逐渐学会做题。
However, by definition of machine learning, neural networks do not work like pure functions, because pure functions require the same output to be produced for the same input value. However, when we construct IQ test robots, we don't expect them to work well as soon as they're born. It should not understand any rules in advance, and gradually learn to do questions after training through questions.

比如这样：
For example:

  1. def lossFunction(robotAnswer: DoubleLayer, expectedAnswer: Double): DoubleLayer = ???
  3. def iqTestRobotTrainer(question: Seq[Double], expectedAnswer: Double): DoubleLayer = {
  4.   val robotAnswer = guessNextNumber(question)
  5.   lossFunction(robotAnswer, expectedAnswer)
  6. }
  8. iqTestRobotTrainer(Seq(3, 4, 5), 6).train.blockingAwait
  9. iqTestRobotTrainer(Seq(13, 19, 25), 31).train.blockingAwait

以上代码中的lossFunction是惩罚函数，用来评估智商测试机器人做题做得好不好。通过调用guessNextNumber和lossFunction，我们编写了一个新函数iqTestRobotTrainer。向iqTestRobotTrainer中输入一道题目和期待的答案，iqTestRobotTrainer就返回一个表示惩罚值的DoubleLayer。
The lossFunction in the above code is a penalty function, which is used to assess whether the IQ test robot did a good job. By calling guessNextNumber and lossFunction , we wrote a new function iqTestRobotTrainer . Enter a question and an expected answer to iqTestRobotTrainer , and iqTestRobotTrainer returns a DoubleLayer representing the penalty value.

注意：我们的智商测试机器人的惩罚函数lossFunction本身也是一个子神经网络，同时也是个可以调用的函数。
Note: The penalty function lossFunction of our IQ test robot is itself a subneural network and a function that can be called.

“惩罚函数是个函数”听起来是一句废话。不幸的是，在其他框架中惩罚函数并不能可以随意调用的函数。比如在TensorFlow中，你可能会这样训练一个模型：
"The penalty function is a function" sounds like nonsense. Unfortunately, in other frameworks, penalizing functions are not functions that can be called at will. For example, in TensorFlow, you might train a model like this:

  1. train_step = tf.train.GradientDescentOptimizer(0.5).minimize(loss_function)
  2. sess.run(train_step, feed_dict=your_minibatch)

这两行代码中loss_function必须要被TensorFlow特殊处理才能让TensorFlow启动训练。
loss_function in these two lines of code must be handled by TensorFlow in order for TensorFlow to start training.

而在DeepLearning.scala中，惩罚函数就是普通的Scala函数，返回的DoubleLayer除了可以求值以外，还可以训练。
In DeepLearning.scala, the penalty function is an ordinary Scala function, and the DoubleLayer returned can be trained in addition to evaluation.

理想情况下，当iqTestRobotTrainer的train方法被反复调用时，智商测试机器人会逐渐学到训练数据中的规律，因而机器人的作答会逐渐接近正确答案，惩罚值也随之缩小。
Ideally, when the train method of iqTestRobotTrainer is repeatedly called, the IQ test robot will gradually learn the rules in the training data, so the robot's answer will gradually approach the correct answer, and the penalty value will shrink.

这是第二个结论：神经网络是可以学习的函数。可以学习的函数暗示了副作用的存在，在本系列的后续篇章里，我会介绍DeepLearning.scala是如何用Monad封装这种副作用的。
This is the second conclusion: neural networks are functions that can be learned. Functions that can be learned hint at the existence of side effects, and in later chapters of this series, I'll show how DeepLearning.scala encapsulates this side effect with Monad.

神经网络是函数模板？
Is a neural network a function template?

神经网络是可以学习的函数，但并不能保证学会任意规律。比如智商测试机器人能学会哪些规律就取决于我们怎么编写惩罚函数lossFunction和预测函数guessNextNumber。
Neural networks are functions that can be learned, but there is no guarantee that arbitrary rules can be learned. For example, what rules the IQ test robot can learn depends on how we write the penalty function lossFunction and the prediction function guessNextNumber .

比如我们可以这样写：
For example, we can write:

  1. // 平方惩罚函数
  2. def lossFunction(robotAnswer: DoubleLayer, expectedAnswer: Double): DoubleLayer = {
  3.   val difference: DoubleLayer = robotAnswer - expectedAnswer
  4.   difference * difference
  5. }
  7. // 惰性初始化的权重列表
  8. val weights: Stream[DoubleWeight] = Stream.continually(DoubleWeight(math.random))
  10. // 用map/reduce编写的多项式加法预测函数
  11. def guessNextNumber(question: Seq[Double]): DoubleLayer = {
  12.   (question zip weights).map {
  13.     case (element, weight) => element * weight
  14.   }.reduce(_ + _)
  15. }

相比普通Scala代码，用DeepLearning.scala写的函数可以在内部引用一些Weight。比如说上面的weights中是个惰性初始化的列表，其中有无限多个DoubleWeight。在训练过程中，这些Weight会为了缩小loss而朝着梯度下降的方向逐渐改变。
Compared to normal Scala code, functions written in DeepLearning.scala can reference some Weight internally. For example, Weightabove is a lazy initialization list with an infinite number of DoubleWeight. During training, these Weight gradually change in the direction of gradient descent in order to narrow loss.

所以用DeepLearning.scala写的函数和普通函数之间的关系有点像PHP和HTML之间的关系，可以看成是为了生成代码而编写的代码模板。虽然整体代码结构由人类手写，但其中的Weight部分则是机器自动学到的知识。
So the relationship between functions written in DeepLearning.scala and ordinary functions is a bit like the relationship between PHP and HTML, which can be seen as code templates written to generate code. Although the overall code structure is handwritten by humans, the Weight part of it is automatically learned by the machine.

比如此处惩罚函数loss是机器人作答和正确答案的差的平方，预测函数guessNextNumber是个系数为weights的多项式加法，只能拟合线性函数。所以它是个线性回归模型。一般机器学习算法往往会用向量运算来表达多项式求和等线性运算，但这些向量运算其实也可以用我们此处所用的函数式编程的map/reduce高阶函数表达。
For example, here the penalty function loss is the square of the difference between the robot's answer and the correct answer, and the prediction function guessNextNumber is a polynomial addition with coefficients of weights, which can only fit a linear function. So it's a linear regression model. General machine learning algorithms often use vector operations to express linear operations such as polynomial summation, but these vector operations can also be expressed in the map / reduce higher-order functions of functional programming we use here.

DeepLearning.scala同样也支持向量运算，向量版的智商测试机器人的完整例子可以在Getting Started中查看。
DeepLearning.scala also supports vector operations, and a complete example of a vector version of IQ testing robots can be viewed in Getting Started.

TODO: 此处缺一张线性回归的网络结构的示意图
TODO: A schematic diagram of the network structure of linear regression is missing here

现在我们得出了第三个结论：神经网络是高阶函数模板。神经网络的能学到什么规律取决于人类手写模板的拟合能力。
Now we come to the third conclusion: neural networks are higher-order function templates. What patterns neural networks can learn depends on the fitting ability of human handwritten templates.

神经网络是半自动编程机器人？
Are neural networks semi-automatic programming robots?

从上面贴出的DeepLearning.scala的代码可以看出，神经网络是具备学习能力的函数模板。恕我直言，这从定义上已经等价于半自动的编程机器人了。
As you can see from the code of DeepLearning.scala posted above, neural networks are functional templates with learning capabilities. IMHO, this is by definition equivalent to a semi-autonomous programming robot.

人类将来也许能造出胜任软件开发完整生命周期的机器人，但就眼下而言，软件开发机器人涉及的领域太多。特别是分析需求和架构设计对人工智能来说，需要的背景知识太多，问题域太开放，短时间内很难实现。
Humans may be able to build robots capable of the full life cycle of software development in the future, but for now, software development robots cover too many fields. Especially for artificial intelligence, the analysis requirements and architecture design require too much background knowledge, the problem domain is too open, and it is difficult to achieve in a short time.

编程机器人，只解决在业务需求已经明确，软件模块已经划分好之后的一个小问题：
Programming robots only solves a small problem after the business requirements have been clarified and the software modules have been divided:

已知软件规格，如何写出相符的代码？
Given the software specifications, how to write the code that matches?

而软件规格，在采用TDD实践的前提下，可以通过测试用例来描述。
Software specifications, on the premise of adopting TDD practices, can be described by test cases.

所以，编程机器人要解决的这个问题也可以表达为：
Therefore, the problem to be solved by programming robots can also be expressed as:

给定测试用例，如何写出能通过测试的代码？
Given a test case, how do you write code that passes the test?

在深度学习的场合，如果把上述定义中的“测试用例”用“训练数据”代替，把“通过测试”用“减小惩罚值”代替，就变成：
In the case of deep learning, if the "test case" in the above definition is replaced by "training data", and "passing the test" is replaced by "reducing the penalty value", it will become:

给定训练数据，如何让神经网络所拟合的函数的惩罚值最小？
Given the training data, how do you minimize the penalty value of the function that the neural network fits?

那么，从定义上说，神经网络就是“由人类提供函数模板（即网络结构）”，“由机器提供权重”的半自动编程机器人。比如，能识别手写数字图片的神经网络，就是由机器自动编写的识别手写数字图片的程序。
Then, by definition, a neural network is a semi-automatic programming robot with "a function template (i.e., a network structure) provided by a human" and a "weight provided by a machine". For example, a neural network that can recognize handwritten digital pictures is a program automatically written by a machine to recognize handwritten digital pictures.

之所以说是半自动编程机器人，是因为目前的人工神经网络仍然需要人类根据不同的训练数据选择不同的网络结构。假如有一天，所有的人工神经网络，不论面对任何数据，都能使用一种通用的网络结构，拟合出不亚于人类手动编写的函数的性能，那么就可以称得上是全自动编程机器人了。
The reason why it is a semi-automatic programming robot is because the current artificial neural network still requires humans to choose different network structures according to different training data. If one day, all artificial neural networks, no matter what kind of data, can use a general network structure to fit the performance of functions no less than those written manually by humans, then it can be called a fully automatic programming robot.

结论

在本篇文章中，我们讨论了看待神经网络的几种方式。最后提出了我们自己的视角，把神经网络看成具有学习能力的函数模板，等价于半自动辅助函数式编程的机器人。我将在下一篇文章中考察近年来广为使用的几种神经网络结构，以及与这些结构对应的DeepLearning.scala的高阶函数模板。
In this article, we discuss several ways to look at neural networks. Finally, we put forward our own perspective, viewing neural networks as functional templates with learning capabilities, equivalent to semi-automatic assisted functional programming robots. In the next article, I will examine several neural network structures that have been widely used in recent years, as well as the higher-order function templates of DeepLearning.scala that correspond to these structures.

神经网络与函数式编程（三）怎么解释神经网络？
Neural Networks and Functional Programming (III) How to Explain Neural Networks?

神经网络与函数式编程

在本系列的上一篇文章神经网络与函数式编程（二）神经网络就是编程机器人？中，我们讨论了看待神经网络的几种视角，最后发现，神经网络其实是具有学习能力的高阶函数模板，可以看成半自动的编程机器人。在本篇文章中，我们会考察近年来广为使用的几种网络结构，以及它们在DeepLearning.scala中对应怎样的函数模板。
Previous article in this series Neural Networks and Functional Programming (II) Neural networks are programming robots? , we discussed several perspectives on neural networks, and finally found that neural networks are actually high-order function templates with learning ability, which can be regarded as semi-automatic programming robots. In this article, we will examine several network structures that have been widely used in recent years and how they correspond to function templates in DeepLearning.scala.

这些函数模板和神经网络之间的对应概念是由克里斯多夫·欧拉在Neural Networks, Types, and Functional Programming中指出的。不过，本文贴出的DeepLearning.scala代码真正可以执行，而不仅仅是概念。
The concept of correspondence between these function templates and neural networks was pointed out by Christopher Euler in Neural Networks, Types, and Functional Programming. However, the DeepLearning.scala code posted in this article is actually executable, not just concepts.

循环神经网络编码器
Recurrent neural network encoder

循环神经网络编码器可以从序列输入中提取一组特征，比如输入一段淘宝买家写的评论，让编码器预测这段文字是个好评还是差评。
The RNN encoder can extract a set of features from a sequence input, such as entering a review written by a Taobao buyer, and ask the encoder to predict whether the text is a positive or bad review.

循环神经网络编码器可以用Scala中的foldLeft实现，其签名如下：
The RNN encoder can be implemented with foldLeft in Scala, which is signed as follows:

  1. package scala.collection
  2. trait Seq[A] {
  3.   def foldLeft[B](z: B)(op: (B, A) => B): B
  4. }

循环神经网络有很多变种，比如GRU和LSTM。我们可以把不同的变种看成是循环体单步执行时采用了不同的step函数实现。
There are many variations of recurrent neural networks, such as GRU and LSTM. We can think of different variants as loops that use different step function implementations when stepping into a loop.

  1. type Input = Seq[DoubleLayer]
  2. type State = Seq[DoubleLayer]
  4. def step(hiddenState: State, xi: Input): State = ???
  6. def encodingRNN(x: Seq[Input]): State = {
  7.   val initialState: State = Seq.empty[DoubleLayer]
  8.   x.foldLeft(initialState)(step)
  9. }

比如如果step采用简单的tanh的话，可以这样写：
For example, if step uses a simple tanh , you can write it like this:

  1. val NumberOfOutputFeatures = 10
  3. val weight: Seq[Seq[DoubleWeight]] = Seq.fill(NumberOfOutputFeatures)(Stream.continually(DoubleWeight(math.random)))
  5. def step(hiddenState: State, xi: Input): State = {
  6.   tanh(matrixMultiply(hiddenState ++ xi, weight))
  7. }

循环神经网络解码器
Recurrent neural network decoder

解码器接受一个种子参数作为隐藏状态不断迭代，输出一个序列，对应Scalaz的高阶函数unfoldr。
The decoder accepts a seed parameter as a hidden state and iterates continuously and outputs a sequence corresponding to Scalaz's higher-order function unfoldr .

  1. package scalaz
  2. object DList {
  3.   def unfoldr[A, B](b: B, f: B => Option[(A, B)]): DList[A]
  4. }
  1. type State = Seq[DoubleLayer]
  2. type Output = Seq[DoubleLayer]
  4. def step(hiddenState: State): Option[(State, Output)] = ???
  6. def generatingRnn(seed: State): DList[Output] = {
  7.   DList.unfoldr(seed)(step)
  8. }

一对一转换的循环神经网络
Recurrent neural networks for one-to-one conversion

一对一转换的RNN不经过编码器和解码器，而是对输入序列中的每一个元素一一转换，直接生成输出序列。适合用于输入和输出长度相同的场合。
The RNN for one-to-one conversion does not go through the encoder and decoder, but transforms each element in the input sequence one by one to directly generate the output sequence. Suitable for applications with the same input and output lengths.

一对一转换的RNN对应Scalaz的高阶函数mapAccumLeft或者mapAccumRight。
The RNN for one-to-one conversion corresponds to Scalaz's higher-order functions mapAccumLeft or mapAccumRight .

  1. package scalaz
  2. class IList[A] {
  3.   def mapAccumLeft[B, C](c: C)(f: (C, A) => (C, B)): (C, IList[B])
  4.   def mapAccumRight[B, C](c: C)(f: (C, A) => (C, B)): (C, IList[B])
  5. }
  1. type State = Seq[DoubleLayer]
  2. type Input = Seq[DoubleLayer]
  3. type Output = Seq[DoubleLayer]
  5. def step(hiddenState: State, xi: Input): (State, Output) = ???
  7. def rnn(x: IList[Input], seed: State): (State, IList[Output]) = {
  8.   x.mapAccumLeft(seed)(step)
  9. }

双向循环神经网络
Bidirectional recurrent neural networks

双向循环神经网络简单的把从左到右和从右到左两个子网络输出结果拼起来即可。
The bidirectional recurrent neural network simply spells together the output results of the two sub-networks from left to right and right to left.

  1. type State = Seq[DoubleLayer]
  2. type Input = Seq[DoubleLayer]
  3. type Output = Seq[DoubleLayer]
  5. def leftStep(hiddenState: State, xi: Input): (State, Output) = ???
  6. def rightStep(hiddenState: State, xi: Input): (State, Output) = ???
  8. def bidirectionalRnn(x: IList[Input], leftSeed: State, rightSeed: State): IList[Output] = {
  9.   val (_, leftToRight) = x.mapAccumLeft(leftSeed)(leftStep)
  10.   val (_, rightToLeft) = x.mapAccumRight(rightSeed)(rightStep)
  11.   leftToRight.zip(rightToLeft).map { pair =>
  12.     pair._1 ++ pair._2
  13.   }
  14. }

一维卷积神经网络
One-dimensional convolutional neural network

卷积神经网络需要用Scala中的zip和map组合起来实现。
Convolutional neural networks need to be implemented using a combination of zip and map in Scala.

  1. package scala.collection.immutable
  2. class List {
  3.   def map[B](f: A => B): List[B]
  4.   def zip[B](that: List[B]): List[(A, B)]
  5. }
  1. type Input = Seq[DoubleLayer]
  2. type Output = Seq[DoubleLayer]
  4. def kernel1x2(xi: Input, xj: Input): Output
  6. def cnn1d(x: List[Input]): List[Output]) = {
  7.   x.zip(x.tail).map(kernel)
  8. }

二维卷积神经网络
Two-dimensional convolutional neural networks

二维卷积神经网络和一维卷积神经网络类似，也可以用Scala中的zip和map实现。
Two-dimensional convolutional neural networks are similar to one-dimensional convolutional neural networks, and can also be implemented with zip and map in Scala.

  1. type Input = Seq[DoubleLayer]
  2. type Output = Seq[DoubleLayer]
  4. def kernel2x2(xi: Input, xj: Input, xk: Input, xl: Input): Output
  6. def cnn2d(x: List[List[Input]]): List[Output]) = {
  7.   val x00 = x
  8.   val x01 = x.map(_.tail)
  9.   val x10 = x.tail
  10.   val x11 = x.tail.map(_.tail)
  11.   (x zip x01 zip x10 zip x11).map {
  12.     case (((xi, xj), xk), xl) => kernel2x2(xi, xj, xk, xl)
  13.   }
  14. }

递归神经网络
Recurrent neural networks

空间递归神经网络主要用于自然语言处理，对应Scalaz的scanr。
Spatial recurrent neural networks are mainly used for natural language processing, corresponding to Scalaz's scanr .

  1. package scalaz
  2. class Tree {
  3.   def scanr[B](g: (A, Stream[Tree[B]]) => B): Tree[B]
  4. }
  1. type Input = Seq[DoubleLayer]
  2. type Output = Seq[DoubleLayer]
  4. def step(x: Input, children: Stream[Output]): Output = ???
  6. def treeNet(x: Tree[Input]): Tree[Output] = {
  7.   x.scanr(step)
  8. }

结论

传统机器学习背景的数据科学家常常觉得神经网络是个黑箱，对深度学习的可解释性会有疑虑。然而当我们把这些特定领域适用的网络结构对应的函数模板写下来时，对于有函数式编程经验的工程师来说，神经网络很好解释。
Data scientists with traditional machine learning backgrounds often feel that neural networks are a black box and have doubts about the interpretability of deep learning. However, when we write down the function templates corresponding to the network structures applicable to these specific domains, neural networks are easy to explain for engineers with experience in functional programming.

过去工程师会用foldLeft遍历字符串搜索特定模式，现在神经网络一样是foldLeft对文本模式匹配。过去写一个编译器需要有多个编译阶段，每个阶段处理前一个阶段的输出，现在用多层神经网络，每一层一样是处理前一层的输出。唯一的区别是，过去工程师硬编码的规则被自动优化的权重所代替。
In the past, engineers would use foldLeft to traverse strings to search for specific patterns, but now neural networks match foldLeft pair of text patterns. In the past, writing a compiler required multiple compilation stages, each processing the output of the previous stage, but now a multi-layer neural network is used, and each layer is the same as the output of the previous layer. The only difference is that the rules that used to be hard-coded by engineers are replaced by weights that are automatically optimized.

从实际效果上看，这正体现了神经网络就是半自动编程机器人，让工程师需要编写的程序变少了。
From a practical point of view, this reflects that neural networks are semi-automatic programming robots, so that engineers need to write fewer programs.

如果想要进一步提高编程机器人的自动化程度，要制造全自动编程机器，则需要发明一种能拟合一切人类手写函数的通用函数模板，让人类不再需要手动编写领域特定的函数模板。“能拟合”不是指数学意义上的“可计算”，而是指实践中能用比人类编程更短的时间训练出比手写代码更优的函数。很容易想到的一种实现通用模板的思路，就是让通用模板中包含各种特定领域的子网络，自动根据样本的特性，有条件的启用适合当前样本的子网络。我将在下一篇文章中介绍如何在DeepLearning.scala中如何用Monad创建有条件启用的子网络。
If you want to further improve the automation of programming robots, to build fully automatic programming machines, you need to invent a universal function template that fits all human handwritten functions, so that humans no longer need to manually write domain-specific function templates. "Fit" is not "computable" in the exponential sense, but refers to the ability to train functions that are better than handwritten code in less time than human programming in practice. It is easy to think of an idea to implement a general template, which is to let the general template contain various domain-specific subnetworks, and automatically conditionally enable subnetworks suitable for the current sample according to the characteristics of the sample. I'll show you how to create conditionally enabled subnetworks with Monad in DeepLearning.scala in the next article.

神经网络与函数式编程（四）Monadic Deep Learning
Neural Networks and Functional Programming (IV) Monadic Deep Learning

神经网络与函数式编程

在本系列的上一篇文章神经网络与函数式编程（三）怎么解释神经网络？中，我们考察了神经网络结构如何与高阶函数一一对应。在本篇文章中，我将展示如何用Monad表达有条件启用的动态神经网络。
In the previous article in this series Neural Networks and Functional Programming (III) How to explain neural networks? , we examine how neural network structures correspond one-to-one with higher-order functions. In this article, I will show how to express conditionally enabled dynamic neural networks in Monad.

三种带条件的神经网络结构
Three neural network structures with conditions

神经网络中常用的条件启用的结构有三种：
There are three commonly used condition-enabled structures in neural networks:

第一种是用非线性函数“过滤”输入，比如ReLU激活函数就相当于if (x > 0) x else 0的条件语句。
The first is to "filter" the input with a nonlinear function, such as a conditional statement in which the ReLU activation function is equivalent to if (x > 0) x else 0 .

第二种是把“门”用于循环单元，比如LSTM和GRU的每个循环单元中都有多个门，每个门以零到一的系数乘以需要过滤的特征，相当于“软性”的条件语句。
The second is to use "gates" for cyclic elements, such as LSTM and GRU each cyclic unit has multiple gates, each gate multiplied by a factor of zero to one by the feature that needs to be filtered, equivalent to a "soft" conditional statement.

第三种是根据每一个样本设置条件启用子网络，比如Sparsely-Gated Mixture-of-Experts。当这类条件不满足时，未启用的子网络不会运行。所以，用这种“硬性”的条件可以训练出非常巨大的神经网络，但针对每个样本只稀疏激活个别子网络，能让网络既拥有巨大的知识容量，又可以运行得很快。
The third is to enable subnetworks based on each sample setting conditions, such as Sparsely-Gated Mixture-of-Experts. When such conditions are not met, unenabled subnetworks do not run. Therefore, with this "hard" condition, a very large neural network can be trained, but only sparsely activating individual subnetworks for each sample allows the network to have both a huge knowledge capacity and can run very fast.

接下来本文将主要聊聊如何用DeepLearning.scala实现最有意思的第三种条件结构，即“硬性”条件。
Next, this article will focus on how to implement the most interesting third conditional structure with DeepLearning.scala, that is, "hard" conditions.

利用predict实现“硬性”条件
Use predict to implement a "hard" condition

实现“硬性”条件的一种明显思路是先执行一遍条件，然后根据条件选择子网络即可。在DeepLearning.scala中可以写成这样：
An obvious idea for implementing a "hard" condition is to execute the condition once and then select the subnetwork based on the condition. In DeepLearning.scala it can be written like this:

  1. type Input = INDArrayLayer
  2. type Output = INDArrayLayer
  3. type Condition = (DoubleLayer, DoubleLayer)
  5. def leftSubnet(input: Input): Output = ???
  6. def rightSubnet(input: Input): Output = ???
  7. def gate(input: Input): Condition = ???
  9. def naiveGatedNet(input: Input): Output = {
  10.   val condition = gate(input)
  11.   if (condition._1.predict.blockingAwait > condition._2.predict.blockingAwait) {
  12.     conditionLeft * leftSubnet(input)
  13.   } else {
  14.     conditionRight * rightSubnet(input)
  15.   }
  16. }

以上的naiveGatedNet涉及gate、leftSubnet、rightSubnet三个子网络。其中gate返回两个系数，表示更倾向于选择leftSubnet和rightSubnet中哪一个子网络分支。
The above naiveGatedNet involves three subnets gate , leftSubnet , and rightSubnet. where gate returns two coefficients, indicating which subnetwork branch leftSubnet and rightSubnet is preferred.

接着，在执行选择的子网络leftSubnet或rightSubnet时，乘以gate返回的系数。这样做可以让神经网络可以反向传播到gate里，使得gate也得到训练。
Next, when executing the selected subnetwork leftSubnet or rightSubnet , multiply by the coefficient returned by gate. Doing so allows the neural network to propagate back to gate , so that gate is also trained.

这样一来，naiveGatedNet就实现了“针对每个样本根据条件启用部分子网络”的效果。
In this way, naiveGatedNet achieves the effect of "enabling partial subnetworks based on conditions for each sample".

然而，naiveGatedNet有一个缺陷。
However, naiveGatedNet has a flaw.

在DeepLearning.scala，所有的Layer，包括标量DoubleLayer和向量INDArrayLayer，都表示一个惰性执行的可微分计算图，直到调用predict或者train才真正执行。
In DeepLearning.scala, all Layer, including scalar DoubleLayer and vector INDArrayLayer , represent a differentiable graph that executes lazily until predict or train is called.

所以naiveGatedNet中调用了两次predict，就会导致计算图求值两次，而naiveGatedNet的用户将来调用naiveGatedNet(input).train或者naiveGatedNet(input).predict时，还会再对计算图求值一次。这样一来gate(input)就被求值了三次。更糟糕的是，Input也是个计算图，也会求值三次。而Input可能包含复杂的特征提取逻辑，重复执行可能浪费太多的计算资源。
Therefore, calling predict twice in naiveGatedNet will cause the graph to be evaluated twice, and the user of naiveGatedNet will evaluate the graph again when calling naiveGatedNet(input).train or naiveGatedNet(input).predict in the future. This makes gate(input) evaluated three times. To make matters worse, Input is also a computational graph and is also evaluated three times. While Input may contain complex feature extraction logic, repeated execution may waste too many computing resources.

所以，用predict实现的“硬性”条件尽管节省了计算leftSubnet或rightSubnet分支的开销，但是代价是前置条件gate(input)被重复计算。这种做法未必划算。
Therefore, although a "hard" condition implemented with predict saves the overhead of calculating branch leftSubnet or rightSubnet , it comes at the cost of precondition gate(input) being double-evaluated. This may not be cost-effective.

动态生成计算图
Dynamically generate computational graphs

如果要在实现“硬性”条件计算图时避免重复计算，就不能使用predict，而必须用flatMap动态生成计算图。
If you want to avoid double counting when implementing a "hard" conditional calculated plot, you cannot use predict , but you must dynamically generate the calculated plot with flatMap .

  1. def monadicGatedNet(input: Input): Output = {
  2.   val condition = gate(input)
  3.   val gatedForward = (condition._1.forward.tuple2(condition._2.forward)).flatMap { pair =>
  4.     if (pair._1.data > pair._2.data) {
  5.       (condition._1 * leftSubnet(input)).forward
  6.     } else {
  7.       (condition._2 * rightSubnet(input)).forward
  8.     }
  9.   }
  10.   INDArrayLayer(gatedForward)
  11. }

flatMap方法是Monad.bind的别名：
The flatMap method is an alias for Monad.bind :

  1. package scalaz
  2. trait Monad[F[_]] extends Apply[F[_]] {
  3.   def point(a: => A): F[A]
  4.   def bind[A, B](fa: F[A])(f: A => F[B]): F[B]
  5. }

我们之所以能写形如fa.flatMap(f)这样的代码，是因为Scalaz提供了一些Ops作为语法糖，能把flatMap转为Monad[F].bind(fa, f)调用，具体在monadicGatedNet中F是Do，所以(condition._1.forward.tuple2(condition._2.forward)).flatMap { pair => ... }相当于Monad[Do].bind(condition._1.forward.tuple2(condition._2.forward), { pair => ...})。
We can write code like fa.flatMap(f) because Scalaz provides some Ops as a syntactic sugar, which can turn flatMap into Monad[F].bind(fa, f) calls, specifically in monadicGatedNet the F is Do, so (condition._1.forward.tuple2(condition._2.forward)).flatMap { pair => ... } is equivalent to Monad[Do].bind(condition._1.forward.tuple2(condition._2.forward), { pair => ...}).

如果以面向对象的角度看待Monad的话，可以把Monad视为设计模式里的“抽象工厂”，其高阶类型参数F[_]表示的则是Monad能生产的产品类型，所以monadicGatedNet中的flatMap生产的产品也就是Do。
If you look at Monad from an object-oriented perspective, you can think of Monad as an "abstract factory" in the design pattern, and its high-order type parameter F[_] represents the type of product that Monad can produce, so the product produced by flatMap in monadicGatedNet is Do.

Do可以用来表示神经网络中的泛型计算图。事实上DoubleLayer和INDArrayLayer就是对Do的一层包装，可以和Do互相转换：
Do can be used to represent a generic computational graph in a neural network. In fact, DoubleLayer and INDArrayLayer are a wrapper of Do , which can be converted to and from Do :

  1. val myDoubleLayer: DoubleLayer = ???
  2. val doDouble: Do[Tape[Double, Double]] = myDoubleLayer.forward
  3. val myDoubleLayer2: DoubleLayer = DoubleLayer(doDouble)
  1. val myINDArrayLayer: INDArrayLayer = ???
  2. val doINDArray: Do[Tape[INDArray, INDArray]] = myINDArrayLayer.forward
  3. val myINDArrayLayer2: INDArrayLayer = INDArrayLayer(doINDArray)

Tape是计算图中的临时结构，这里不用细究，只要知道通过tape.data能够取得计算结果就行了。本系列的后续文章会讲解Tape的内部构造。
Tape is a temporary structure in the calculation graph, there is no need to go into detail here, as long as you know that the calculation result can be obtained through tape.data . Subsequent articles in this series will explain the internals of Tape.

回到Monad[Do]中的bind，也就是我们所使用的flatMap，其签名等价于：
Going back to bind in Monad[Do] , which is the flatMap we are using, its signature is equivalent to:

  1. def bind[A, B](fa: Do[A])(f: A => Do[B]): Do[B]

它的含义是生产一个两阶段的动态计算图Do[B]。第一阶段的计算图是fa。第二阶段计算图得在第一阶段计算完毕后，再由回调函数f根据第一阶段的结果A的值动态生成，而不能事先确定。
It means that it produces a two-stage dynamic calculation Figure Do[B] . The first stage of the calculation graph is fa . The second-stage computational graph has to be dynamically generated by the callback function f based on the value of the result A of the first stage after the calculation of the first stage, and cannot be determined in advance.

粗粒度并行计算
Coarse-grained parallel computing

另一处细节是(condition._1.forward.tuple2(condition._2.forward))，调用了`tuple2把两个计算图和成一个计算图：
Another detail is (condition._1.forward.tuple2(condition._2.forward)) , which calls 'tuple2 to sum the two computational graphs into one:

  1. package scalaz
  2. trait Apply[F[_]] {
  3.   def tuple2[A, B](fa: => F[A], fb: => F[B]): F[(A, B)]
  4. }

这是因为gate签名里返回的是两个计算图，所以需要合并以后才能flatMap。
This is because the gate signature returns two computational graphs, so it needs to be merged to flatMap .

不过，直接调用tuple2可能不一定是最高效的写法，因为Monad中tuple2的默认实现是串行计算，这意味着condition._2.forward要等到condition._1.forward算完后才开始计算。理想情况下应该可以让condition._1.forward和condition._2.forward同时计算，以便缩短延时。在DeepLearning.scala可以这样实现：
However, calling tuple2 directly may not necessarily be the most efficient way to write it, because the default implementation of tuple2 in Monad is a serial calculation, which means that condition._2.forward does not start counting until condition._1.forward is finished. Ideally, you should have condition._1.forward and condition._2.forward calculated simultaneously to reduce latency. In DeepLearning.scala it can be implemented like this:

  1. def parallelGatedNet(input: Input): Output = {
  2.   val condition = gate(input)
  3.   val parallelCondition1Forward: ParallelDo[Tape[Double, Double]] = Parallel(condition._1.forward)
  4.   val parallelCondition2Forward: ParallelDo[Tape[Double, Double]] = Parallel(condition._2.forward)
  5.   val parallelConditionForward = condition1ForwardParallel.tuple2(condition2ForwardParallel)
  6.   val gatedForward = parallelConditionForward.unwrap.flatMap { pair =>
  7.     if (pair._1.data > pair._2.data) {
  8.       (condition._1 * leftSubnet(input)).forward
  9.     } else {
  10.       (condition._2 * rightSubnet(input)).forward
  11.     }
  12.   }
  13.   INDArrayLayer(gatedForward)
  14. }

以上代码中，Parallel(...)把一个Do包装成了ParallelDo，表示需要并行执行的计算图。这样一来，如果对ParallelDo调用tuple2以及其他所有的高阶函数，就会生成并行计算的计算图。在tuple2以后，需要调用upwrap把ParallelDo转回Do，因为flatMap是两阶段计算图，不可能支持并行计算。最后生成的计算图如下：
In the above code, Parallel(...) wraps a Do into ParallelDo, which represents the computational graph that needs to be executed in parallel. In this way, if you call tuple2 on ParallelDo and all other higher-order functions, a graph of parallel computation is generated. After tuple2 , you need to call upwrap to turn ParallelDo back to Do, because flatMap is a two-stage computational graph and it is impossible to support parallel computing. The resulting calculation graph is as follows:

TODO: 此处缺一张图
TODO: There's a missing picture here

事实上，所有INDArrayLayer的内置二元操作都会自动用ParallelDo来并行计算。
In fact, all built-in binary operations of INDArrayLayer are automatically parallelized with ParallelDo.

虽然GPU本身也支持并行计算，但GPU算完一个操作后，在等待CPU给GPU提交下一次计算命令以前，GPU只能干等，计算力就被浪费了。我们利用ParallelDo提供的粗粒度并行计算，同时提交多个计算命令，可以维持GPU一直繁忙，避免发生GPU饥饿。
Although the GPU itself also supports parallel computing, after the GPU calculates an operation, before waiting for the CPU to submit the next calculation command to the GPU, the GPU can only wait, and the computing power is wasted. We use the coarse-grained parallel computation provided by ParallelDo to submit multiple compute commands at the same time, which can keep the GPU busy and avoid GPU starvation.

ThoughtWorks Each

最后，对函数式编程的初学者来说，可能比较难理解Monad的概念。我们提供了ThoughtWorks Each，能够自动把.each调用编译成flatMap或者map。初学者不需要手写flatMap就可以利用Each生成动态神经网络了：
Finally, it can be difficult for beginners in functional programming to understand the concept of Monad . We provide ThoughtWorks Each, which automatically compiles .each calls into flatMap or map . Beginners do not need to write by hand flatMap to use Each to generate dynamic neural networks:

  1. def eachGatedNet(input: Input): Output = INDArrayLayer(monadic[Do] {
  2.   val condition = gate(input)
  3.   val parallelCondition1Forward: ParallelDo[Tape[Double, Double]] = Parallel(condition._1.forward)
  4.   val parallelCondition2Forward: ParallelDo[Tape[Double, Double]] = Parallel(condition._2.forward)
  5.   val parallelConditionForward = condition1ForwardParallel.tuple2(condition2ForwardParallel)
  6.   val pair = parallelConditionForward.unwrap.each
  7.   if (pair._1.data > pair._2.data) {
  8.     (condition._1 * leftSubnet(input)).forward.each
  9.   } else {
  10.     (condition._2 * rightSubnet(input)).forward.each
  11.   }
  12. })

结论

Monad既简单又强大。在ThoughtWorks Each的帮助下，你可以同时获得动态计算图和粗粒度并行计算的好处，而依旧保持很简洁的代码结构。
Monad is simple and powerful. With the help of ThoughtWorks Each, you can reap the benefits of both dynamic graphs and coarse-grained parallel computation while still maintaining a clean code structure.

谷歌最近的论文One Model To Learn Them All展示了通用神经网络的前景。人类的神经元数量约有860亿，包含各种不同形态和功能的专用神经细胞。未来的通用人工神经网络一定也和人类神经系统一样，既巨大又复杂，处理特定任务时动态稀疏激活。我们相信Monadic Deep Learning将在通用人工智能上大有可为！
Google's recent paper, One Model To Learn Them All, shows the promise of general-purpose neural networks. There are about 86 billion neurons in humans, containing specialized nerve cells of all shapes and functions. Future general-purpose artificial neural networks must be as large and complex as the human nervous system, dynamically sparsely activated when dealing with specific tasks. We believe that Monadic Deep Learning will have great potential for general artificial intelligence!

除了动态神经网络以外，通用的神经网络会内置不同功能的模块，这就需要以可扩展的方式添加新功能。我将在下一篇文章中介绍DeepLearning.scala的插件系统如何利用依赖类型系统解决Expression Problem，既支持添加新功能也可以修改现有功能的行为。
In addition to dynamic neural networks, general-purpose neural networks have built-in modules for different functions, which requires adding new functions in an extensible way. I'll show in the next article how DeepLearning.scala's plugin system leverages the dependency type system to solve the Expression Problem, both by adding new functionality and by modifying the behavior of existing functionality.
